description: Global economic crisis triggered by the COVID-19 pandemic, causing supply-chain disruptions, lockdowns, and demand collapse.
Nationwide quarantines and travel bans imposed to contain the virus.
Delays and shortages caused by halted manufacturing and transport.
Mass layoffs and furloughs resulting from business shutdowns.
Central banks slashed rates and launched liquidity programs.
Massive government spending to support households and businesses.
Rapid shift to digital-first work environments.
Rapid global equity sell-off due to pandemic uncertainty.
Divergent rebound where tech and capital markets surged while labor recovery lagged.
Global biotech effort to develop effective COVID-19 vaccines.
Historic drop in oil demand drove WTI futures below zero for the first time.
Unlimited quantitative-easing program to stabilize credit and MBS markets.
ECB's Pandemic Emergency Purchase Programme worth â‚¬1.85 trillion.
U.S. forgivable loans aimed at keeping small-business payrolls intact.
Consumer spending pivoted sharply online, boosting digital retail revenues.
Semiconductor supply crunch disrupting autos and electronics production.
Post-pandemic demand + supply bottlenecks pushed CPI to multi-decade highs.
Record job openings and quits as economies reopened.
Regulatory waivers and consumer uptake drove telemedicine mainstream.
Successful deployment of Pfizer-BioNTech & Moderna vaccines in record time.
